p: Healthy male Sprague-Dawley (SD) rats weighing 210–290 g were used to assess the effects of S. mukorossi seed oil on skin wound healing. The rats were obtained from the Laboratory Animal Center at the National Applied Research Laboratories (Hsinchu, Taiwan). The animals were kept in hygienic cages during the experimental period. The environment was maintained with a 12-hour light/dark cycle, a temperature at 21 °C, and a humidity of 60% to 70%. The study protocol and procedures were reviewed and approved by the Institution Animal Care and Use Committee or Panel (IACUC Approval No. L10708, 16 October 2018, and all efforts were made to minimize animal number and suffering to produce reliable scientific data.
